intro: Cyathea schlimii, commonly known as the Schlim’s tree fern, is a tropical evergreen fern belonging to the family Cyatheaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, compound leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fronds are typically bi- or tri-pinnate, with a distinctive, upright growth habit. Cyathea schlimii plays an important ecological role in forest ecosystems, providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
